description: Physical security perimeter protecting Reliability Coordinator control center facilities including building structure perimeter fencing and access control points. Must prevent unauthorized physical access to BES Cyber Systems.
boundary_definition: Outer perimeter fencing around entire facility; Building walls/doors; Inner secure operations area with separate access controls; Server room with biometric access; Secure cable routes
protected_assets: Control room; Operations floor; Server room; Communication equipment; SCADA systems; UPS systems; Cable infrastructure; Meeting rooms with BCSI materials
access_control_type: Badge reader system (dual reader); Biometric fingerprint; PIN pad; Mantrap/man trap at main entrance; Vehicle barriers; Guard desk with camera monitoring; Visitor escort requirement
surveillance_type: 24/7 CCTV coverage; Multiple camera angles (entrance exits perimeter); Video recording with 90-day minimum retention; Motion detection in server room; Alarm system integrated with facility security; Law enforcement notification capability
monitoring_requirements: 24/7 active monitoring by security personnel or remote SOC; Daily patrol logs; Perimeter integrity checks; Access log review; Incident investigation procedures; Coordination with law enforcement; Quarterly testing of detection systems
testing_frequency: Annual physical security testing (CIP-014 compliance); Biennial tabletop exercises; Quarterly perimeter inspection; Penetration testing of access controls annually
documentation: PSP diagram showing perimeter; Access point list and security specifications; CCTV system diagram; Asset inventory within PSP; Alarm system documentation; Visitor control procedures; Emergency procedures
cip_014_critical: Yes - High Impact control center presumed CIP-014 critical; Biennial physical security testing required; Enhanced barriers; Armed response capability; Law enforcement coordination

description: Physical security perimeter for nuclear generation plant BES Cyber Systems coordinated with NRC 10 CFR 73 physical security requirements. Separate from NRC vital area but overlapping in many areas.
perimeter_type: Site Boundary + Protected Area + Vital Areas
boundary_definition: NRC protected area fence (typically 2000+ feet perimeter) with vehicle barriers; Inner vital areas for safety systems (NRC 10 CFR 73); Cyber-specific boundary around non-safety control systems in plant
protected_assets: Non-safety BES Cyber Systems: Generator controls; Turbine controls; Balance of plant; Communication systems; Not including reactor protection (NRC-protected)
access_control_type: Armed response force (NRC requirement); Badge reader with biometric; Visitor/contractor pre-screening; Vehicle screening; Access control logs coordinated with NRC; Controlled access to control building
surveillance_type: NRC video surveillance integrated; Plant-specific CCTV in control areas; Perimeter monitoring; Radiation detection integration; Intrusion detection (multiple technologies); 24/7 monitoring coordination with NRC
monitoring_requirements: 24/7 armed security force; NRC-coordinated monitoring; Access log review per NRC procedures; Intrusion detection monitoring; Coordinated emergency response; NRC notification requirements
testing_frequency: Annual security drill (NRC); Biennial testing of access controls; Annual review of threat assessment; Quarterly security patrol schedule; Penetration testing coordinated with NRC (typically annual)
documentation: PSP diagram (BCSI and NRC-protected); Overlap diagram with NRC vital areas; Access point documentation; Armed response procedures; Emergency procedures; Law enforcement coordination; NRC integration documentation
cip_014_critical: Yes - High Impact generation (>1500 MW) and NRC dual regulation; NRC 10 CFR 73 compliance; Armed response force; Biennial testing; Enhanced physical security; Integrated with NRC security plan

description: Physical security perimeter protecting critical transmission substation with 765kV equipment and protective systems. Remote location with limited staffing; integrated approach to perimeter and monitoring.
perimeter_type: Substation Perimeter Fence + Control Building + Equipment Areas
boundary_definition: 6-foot minimum fencing around entire substation equipment; Locked gate at access; Control/relay building with separate access; Critical equipment areas with additional barriers; Cable storage with tamper detection
protected_assets: 765kV breakers and transformers; Protective relay systems; RTU/SCADA equipment; Communication equipment; Substation control building; Generator/backup power; UPS systems; Spare equipment storage
access_control_type: Perimeter fence with gate (typically locked; access by key or card); Substation building door lock; Relay room access (card reader); Service gate for maintenance vehicles; Visitor escort required for any access
surveillance_type: Perimeter surveillance (4-8 cameras depending on size); Equipment area monitoring; Entrance camera; Motion detection on fences; Remote CCTV to control center if staffed; Video recording with storage; Alarm system monitoring
monitoring_requirements: Remote monitoring to control center 24/7; Automated alarm response; Intrusion detection via cameras/sensors; Routine patrol logs; Access violation investigation; Emergency response procedures; Quarterly system testing
testing_frequency: Annual perimeter integrity inspection; Biennial fence testing; Penetration testing of gate/locks (annual); Intrusion detection system testing (quarterly); Environmental impact assessment (vegetation growth clearing)
documentation: PSP diagram; Perimeter specifications; Equipment protection details; Access point list; CCTV system diagram; Alarm system documentation; Maintenance access procedures; Emergency contact procedures
cip_014_critical: Yes if >=765kV per bright-line; Biennial physical security testing; Enhanced barriers; Law enforcement coordination possible; Critical facility designations vary by region and risk assessment

description: Physical security perimeter protecting wind farm substation with converter equipment and interconnection breakers. Large geographic area with distributed turbines; focused protection on substation.
perimeter_type: Substation Perimeter Fence + Equipment Enclosure + Remote Turbine Network
boundary_definition: Fencing around central substation (1000-2000 feet perimeter); Fence around inverter/equipment area if outdoor; Building for control systems if applicable; Turbine network may be separate or unprotected; Large geographic footprint
protected_assets: Substation equipment: Inverters (if outdoor); Breakers; Transformers; Relay systems; Substation control system; SCADA equipment; Communication systems; Power conversion equipment; Spare inverters
access_control_type: Perimeter fence with service gate (typically locked); Pedestrian gate; No staffed gate (remote location); Turbine access typically open; Keycard/pin for control building if present; Visitor escort not typical for wind farms; Service vehicle access via locked gate
surveillance_type: Surveillance cameras at substation (2-4 cameras); Fence line monitoring if available; Gate alarm/intrusion detection; Remote monitoring to operations center; Less intensive than staffed facilities due to remote location; Periodic patrol by maintenance personnel
monitoring_requirements: Remote monitoring by operations center; Alarm notification; Intrusion detection monitoring where installed; Periodic patrol logs; Service access logging; Quarterly or semi-annual equipment inspections; Environmental monitoring (icing wind threats)
testing_frequency: Annual perimeter inspection (especially fence condition); Biennial testing of locks and gate mechanisms; Semi-annual vegetation clearance; Intrusion detection testing (where installed); Wind turbine inspection includes assessment of surrounding area security
documentation: PSP diagram (especially if CIP applies); Fence specifications; Substation equipment layout; Access point documentation; Alarm system (if any); Maintenance access procedures; Environmental challenges documentation
cip_014_critical: Medium Impact if facility >75 MW; CIP-014 evaluation based on capacity and function; Biennial testing only if CIP-014 critical; Most wind farms do not meet CIP-014 criteria; Emerging challenges with remote monitoring

description: Physical security perimeter protecting control center building housing critical BES Cyber Systems including EMS SCADA and real-time monitoring systems. Integrated building security with cyber-specific requirements.
perimeter_type: Multi-Layer: Building Perimeter + Operations Floor + Server Room + Secure Room
boundary_definition: Building entrance(s) with controlled access; Security desk at main entrance; Operations area floor with access control; Elevated server room with separate access; Secure conference rooms for BCSI discussions; Parking area perimeter if included
protected_assets: Control room equipment; EMS/SCADA servers; Communication systems; UPS systems; Generator; Network infrastructure; SIEM systems; Backup systems; Cabling infrastructure; Training simulators; Administrative areas (must exclude public areas)
access_control_type: Main entrance badge reader (dual badge requirement); Biometric at operations floor; Server room biometric + PIN; Mantrap at critical access; Visitor escort procedure (all visitors); Staff identification; Turnstile/access control at operations entry
surveillance_type: 24/7 CCTV in all common areas; Operations floor surveillance; Server room cameras; Entry/exit cameras; Perimeter surveillance (parking/exits); Video recording with 90+ day retention; Real-time monitoring display in security area; Emergency notification capability
monitoring_requirements: 24/7 monitoring by security personnel (on-site or remote); Security desk staffing during operations; Intrusion detection active 24/7; Access log review (daily); Incident investigation procedures; Coordination with law enforcement; Emergency response procedures; Real-time alert capability
testing_frequency: Annual security assessment; Biennial penetration testing of access controls; Quarterly surveillance system testing; Annual badge system review; Annual emergency drill; Quarterly maintenance access review; Continuous monitoring for anomalies
documentation: Building PSP diagram; All access point specifications; CCTV system topology; Security system architecture; Badge system design; Emergency procedures; Visitor control procedures; BCSI material handling procedures
cip_014_critical: Yes - High Impact control center presumed CIP-014 critical; Biennial physical security testing required; Enhanced security measures; Armed security possible; Law enforcement coordination; Continuous monitoring requirements

description: Physical security perimeter for unmanned remote substation with minimal staffing and limited access. Challenging environment for physical security due to remoteness and limited deterrents.
perimeter_type: Perimeter Fence + Equipment Area + Control Enclosure
boundary_definition: Fencing around equipment area (2-3 feet typical); Locked gate at access point; Control equipment in weatherproof enclosure with lock; Cable trays/equipment access limited by design; Large geographic area; Environmental exposure (trees vegetation)
protected_assets: Substation breakers and switches; Protective relays; RTU/SCADA interface; Communication equipment; Substation control enclosure; Spare equipment storage area; Power supply
access_control_type: Perimeter fence with service gate (typically locked); Enclosure door lock (mechanical key or electronic); No staffed access point; Very limited visitor access; Maintenance crews have keys; Vehicle access via locked gate; Rare on-site presence
surveillance_type: Limited surveillance due to cost/environment; Camera at gate if any; No continuous monitoring; Occasional remote surveillance feasible; Intrusion detection minimal; Reliance on physical barriers more than detection; Environmental challenges (wildlife camera triggers)
monitoring_requirements: Remote monitoring of alarms only (if system installed); Routine patrol by maintenance crews (quarterly or semi-annual); Access logging via mechanical lock check (limited); Incident response via service call dispatch; No 24/7 active monitoring typical for unmanned substations
testing_frequency: Annual perimeter inspection (critical); Biennial lock and gate functional test; Vegetation management (semi-annual); Environmental hazard assessment; Intrusion detection testing (if installed); Service access logging (manual records)
documentation: PSP diagram; Perimeter specifications; Access point details; Environmental factors documentation; Maintenance access procedures; Emergency procedures; Limited documentation compared to staffed facilities
cip_014_critical: Medium Impact if applicable; Biennial testing required only if CIP-014 critical (rare for remote substations); Most unmanned substations do not meet CIP-014 bright-line; Security challenges due to remote location and limited resources

description: Physical security perimeter within control center or facility protecting critical servers and network equipment housing BES Cyber Systems. Indoor secure room with enhanced access controls and monitoring.
perimeter_type: Secure Server Room: Locked Door + Biometric + Cable Management + Environmental Controls
boundary_definition: Separate room with solid walls; Locked door with electronic lock (card reader + pin); Biometric reader for critical area; Mantrap if high security; Cable trays separated from general areas; Environmental controls (cooling power UPS); Server racks with locked access
protected_assets: BES Cyber Asset servers; SCADA servers; EMS servers; Communication equipment; Network switches and routers; UPS systems; Generator interface; Backup systems; Cable distribution; Monitoring systems; Fire suppression system
access_control_type: Door lock: Electronic card reader + PIN requirement; Biometric fingerprint for senior staff; Mantrap entrance; Caged server racks with locks; Key control for physical access; Badge verification logged; Visitor access rarely permitted (engineering escort required)
surveillance_type: CCTV cameras in room (multiple angles); Real-time monitoring display; Intrusion detection (door sensors); Temperature/humidity monitoring; Power monitoring (UPS); Environmental hazard detection (fire smoke); Video recording with encrypted storage; Motion detection in after-hours
monitoring_requirements: 24/7 continuous monitoring (part of broader control center security); Environmental monitoring systems active continuously; Alert on unauthorized access or anomalies; Real-time response capability; Access log review; Temperature/humidity trending; Equipment health monitoring; Incident logging and investigation procedures
testing_frequency: Annual comprehensive security assessment; Biennial penetration testing of door/locks; Quarterly environmental system testing; Monthly access review (who accessed when); Weekly equipment health checks; Annual fire suppression system testing; Real-time monitoring continuous
documentation: Server room layout diagram; Access control specifications; CCTV system diagram; Environmental control system; Power distribution diagram; Cable management; Fire suppression system documentation; Emergency procedures; Equipment inventory
cip_014_critical: High Impact control centers: Yes CIP-014 critical; Biennial physical security testing; Enhanced access controls; Environmental protection emphasis; Integration with building PSP; Redundancy for critical equipment typical

description: Physical security perimeter protecting industrial control systems and DCS environments in generation plants or substations. Specialized environment with unique access challenges and operational requirements.
perimeter_type: Control Room Boundary: Secured Entrance + Personnel Accountability + Network Segregation
boundary_definition: Main entrance with access control; Operations personnel only in normal control room; Visitor areas separated; Control room windows for observation only (no access); Physical separation from non-essential areas; Emergency exit with security verification; Network equipment separate from operational control room
protected_assets: DCS (Distributed Control System); Boiler control systems; Turbine control systems; Generator control systems; Protective relay panels; Instrumentation; Communication systems; HMI (Human-Machine Interface) stations; Support systems; UPS for control systems; Fire protection systems (detection only; suppression external)
access_control_type: Access control at entry (card reader + PIN); Biometric for sensitive areas; Visitor badge system with escort; Personnel accountability (sign-in/out logs); Temporary access procedures for contractors; Shift change verification; Alarm reset procedures
surveillance_type: CCTV at entrance and key points; Instrumentation monitoring displays; Alarm system (linked to operations); Intrusion detection at entry; Access logging (real-time); Operator activity monitoring (HMI systems); Environmental monitoring (temperature vibration pressure)
monitoring_requirements: 24/7 active monitoring by facility operators; Real-time alarm response; Access log review per shift; Continuous operational monitoring; Environmental parameter tracking; Emergency response procedures; Coordination with plant management; Safety system integration
testing_frequency: Annual security assessment; Biennial access control testing; Quarterly alarm system testing; Annual emergency drill; Monthly environmental system review; Ongoing operator vigilance training; Continuous real-time monitoring
documentation: Control room layout diagram (security-sensitive); Access point specifications; CCTV system diagram; Alarm system architecture; Emergency procedures; Visitor control procedures; Operational procedures integration; Safety system interfaces; Environmental monitoring parameters
cip_014_critical: Generation facilities >1500 MW: High Impact CIP-014 critical; Biennial testing required; Enhanced security measures; Safety system coordination (critical - no interference with safety); Operational continuity emphasis; NRC coordination (if nuclear)
